name: chat.scheduleMessage
desc: Schedules a message to be sent to a channel.

as_user.desc: Set to `true` to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. Cannot be used by [new Slack apps](/quickstart). See [chat.postMessage](chat.postMessage#authorship).

attachments.desc: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

blocks.desc: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

channel.desc: Channel, private group, or DM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See [below](#channels) for more details.

link_names.desc: Find and link user groups. No longer supports linking individual users; use syntax shown in [Mentioning Users](/messaging/formatting-message-text#mentioning-users) instead.

markdown_text.desc: Accepts message text formatted in markdown. This argument should not be used in conjunction with `blocks` or `text`. Limit this field to 12,000 characters.

metadata.desc: JSON object with event_type and event_payload fields, presented as a URL-encoded string. Metadata you post to Slack is accessible to any app or user who is a member of that workspace.

parse.desc: Change how messages are treated. See [chat.postMessage](chat.postMessage#formatting).

post_at.desc: Unix timestamp representing the future time the message should post to Slack.

reply_broadcast.desc: Used in conjunction with `thread_ts` and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to `false`.

text.desc: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. [See below](#text_usage) for more detail.

thread_ts.desc: Provide another message's `ts` value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's `ts` value; use its parent instead.

unfurl_links.desc: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

unfurl_media.desc: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

errors.invalid_blocks: Blocks submitted with this message are not valid
errors.invalid_blocks_format: The `blocks` is not a valid JSON object or doesn't match the Block Kit syntax.
errors.markdown_text_conflict: Markdown text cannot be used in conjunction with `blocks` or `text` argument.
errors.message_limit_exceeded: Members on this team are sending too many messages. For more details, see https://slack.com/help/articles/115002422943-Usage-limits-for-free-workspaces
errors.metadata_must_be_sent_from_app: Message metadata can only be posted or updated using an app-level token
errors.not_in_channel: Cannot post user messages to a channel they are not in.
errors.rate_limited: Application has posted too many messages, [read the Rate Limit documentation](/apis/web-api/rate-limits) for more information
errors.restricted_action: A workspace preference prevents the authenticated user from posting.
errors.restricted_action_non_threadable_channel: Cannot post thread replies into a non_threadable channel.
errors.restricted_action_read_only_channel: Cannot post any message into a read-only channel.
errors.restricted_action_thread_only_channel: Cannot post top-level messages into a thread-only channel.
errors.restricted_too_many: Too many messages were scheduled in the channel for a given period. See [usage info](/reference/methods/chat.scheduleMessage#restrictions) for additional details
errors.slack_connect_file_link_sharing_blocked: Admin has disabled Slack File sharing in all Slack Connect communications
errors.time_in_past: value passed for `post_time` was in the past.
errors.time_too_far: value passed for `post_time` was too far into the future.
errors.too_many_attachments: Too many attachments were provided with this message. A maximum of 100 attachments are allowed on a message.
errors.invalid_token: The passed token is invalid or not supported by this method.
